result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac Abraham Bennett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have No Confrontational or Argumentative contact with K. Chmiel.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.   Defendant to complete an Anger Management Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

Court orders bond posted of $150.00 be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac Abraham Bennett

records.addlTxt: 1:53 pm case called. Defendant Isaac Abraham Bennett in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over motion previously filed by the State. Agreement has been reached with admission of material violation of agreement. Agreement vacated and conviction entered. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 45 days WCJ, STAYED and places on probation for a period of 12 months. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. CONDITIONS: No Confrontational/argumentative contact with K. Chmiel. AODA and follow through. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Anger Management and follow through. Terms of Agent. DNA sample to be provided and cost assessed. Expungement of DNA  Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.
Motion hearing on June 28, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Case Called @ 4:08 PM: Defendant Isaac Abraham Bennett in court with attorney Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Due to recent SPD appointment, Atty Szilagyi requests add'l time to investigate the issues of the motion and parties are not prepared to proceed.  Court will toll PPDA as to time limitations - agreement remains in effect as to substantive components however.  Def understands same.  Motion Hrg adjourned - NOH given.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Case Called @ 2:48 PM: Defendant Isaac Abraham Bennett in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA outlines terms of PPDA offered.  Victim present in court today.  Defendant advised of right to counsel.  Court accepts voluntary waiver of counsel.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of PPDA. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Victim declines to make statement today.  Court reviewed the VIS previously filed.  Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and stays JOC.  Court accepts terms and conditions of PPDA.  Matter stayed for 12 mos.  Defendant reminded that bond remains in effect during pendency of PPDA.
Statement of Loss/Damage and Restitution Summary - $1800.00

Pre-trial conference at 07-15-2015 10:30 am.
Status conference at 08-04-2015 10:20 am.

Case Called @ 2:23 PM: Defendant Isaac Abraham Bennett in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does wish to have counsel and requests to speak with SPD.  Court believes based upon assets he may not qualify for SPD services.  He states that the asset is not owned by him, his mother's owns the residence.  SPD present in courtroom and upon quick review does not believe that Def will qualify for services.  Def requests to speak with the State on his own without counsel.  Court accepts Def's waiver of counsel today.   NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 10:20 am.
